result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashad Buggs-Barnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All Court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); all applicable fees of supervision. No cash bail posted in this matter. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with : WILLIAM C.

Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Upon successful completion of probation, the Court will consider motion for expungement.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME. Court stayed commencement until 12-19-14 at 5pm with release on 12-31-14.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashad Buggs-Barnett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rashad Buggs-Barnett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Romond B.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  60 MONTHS with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the Earned Release program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 13 days condition time, STRAIGH TIME.  Court stayed commencement until 12-19-2014 at 5pm with release on 12-31-2014.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: WILLIAM C.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- 100 hours of community service.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Upon successful completion of probation, the Court will consider motion for expungement.

Filed:

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Private PSI received and filed.

Defendant Rashad Buggs-Barnett in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties appear to address Justice Point Violation Report filed with the Court this afternoon.  Court admonishes defendant about negative report, and informs defendant that further violations could affect his bail and/or sentencing.

Defendant Rashad Buggs-Barnett in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Attempt Theft From Person Or Corpse, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), Wisconsin Stat, a CLASS G FELONY.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI WAS ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-04-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Violation, FILED.
Defendant to report to Branch 22 at 01:30pm to address violation.  Both counsels notified of the same.
FILED.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rashad Buggs-Barnett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Rashad Buggs-Barnett in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
